title: Gerrit Noordzij
content:
**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20141031101342/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Designers](http://web.archive.org/web/20141031101342/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Designers) : Gerrit Noordzij**

Pronounced "Herit Noortza", Gerrit Noordzij is a designer, historian, author, and long-time professor at the [Royal Academy of Art](http://web.archive.org/web/20141031101342/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Royal%20Academy%20of%20Art) in the Hague. He developed an original theory of writing, published in his books, [The Stroke Theory of Writing](http://web.archive.org/web/20141031101342/http:/typophile.com/wiki/The%20Stroke%20Theory%20of%20Writing), and [Letterletter](http://web.archive.org/web/20141031101342/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Letterletter).

There is a prize in his honor given every three years. Past winners were [Fred Smeijers](http://web.archive.org/web/20141031101342/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Fred%20Smeijers), [Erik Spiekermann](http://web.archive.org/web/20141031101342/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Erik%20Spiekermann), [Tobias Frere-Jones](http://web.archive.org/web/20141031101342/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Tobias%20Frere-Jones), and [Wim Crouwel](http://web.archive.org/web/20141031101342/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Wim%20Crouwel).
